reviewText: I'm typically cynical about anything that is not proven-fact/black & white/brick & mortar, and I've definitely never been into mythology. After watching Mythic Journeys, I still can't say I'm a fan of mythology per se, but the ideas and philosophies that seem to inspire the movie - as well as the fictional characters and "real" individuals we're introduced to - were also inspiring to me and my family. The film itself is exceptionally done. It's extremely imaginative but still firmly rooted in reality. It's very engaging, thought-provoking and never "talks down" to its audience. The idea that I came away with after watching the movie is that you create your own reality, and that my reality is possibly as good a story - if not even better a story - than the best literature I've ever read. It's a fun and intriguing notion, and for that alone I rated it very highly.

I first must admit to a certain conflict of interest here, in that I helped to organize the Mythic Journeys conferences which formed the initial inspiration for this film. But the Boe's have taken the question of myth's meaning in modern life in their own direction and have made a wonderful film about it. Even without the fascinating interviews and commentary from such brilliant myth-folk like Michael Meade, Robert Walter, Honora Foah and others, the animated sequences -- voiced by Mark Hamill, Tim Curry, and Lance Henricksen -- are worth the price of the DVD alone. I highly recommend this film. Don't just watch it alone -- it makes for a great viewing party.
Interesting stories

A very happy discovery! As a long-time follower of Joseph Campbell's works and career, it was exciting to experience this new, multi-cultural take on the significance of myth in our lives.

This video is more important today than ever. To be able to look at the face of the kind of uncertainty we have to deal with in so many areas of life (racial, financial, sexual, environmental, class, religious, political, universal, age and basic humanity) it is most urgent to see our lives in the largest context of all, spiritually.  We need the help of wisdom in all its forms and throughout all history to connect what is the greatest good to this time and space. To realize the wonder of love in action to both sides of the 1% and all in between is our highest goal and gives us the ability to go on day by day instead of giving up in fear. This video helps us to connect or reconnect to the primal self and explains in creative and plain language as well as story our true oneness with all creation. For those who don't want to live in fear, hate, denial and despair this is most necessary.
This was a wonderful movie that highlighted the importance of remembering the lessons of our ancient stories while avoiding the dogma.
